verbose_text: The relative paucity of MGL expression in the neonatal cerebrum XREF_BIBR irrespective of its neuronal or glial origin (that is, thalamocortical axons are the main source of MGL by birth), and its subcellular exclusion from growth domains XREF_BIBR emphasize that DAGL activity and paracrine 2-AG signaling can critically shape the complexity and orientation of corticopetal axons originating in the basal forebrain.
